items.content_html: And related to my previous post… The downside to working in downtown Seattle is when light rail service is suspended to where you live due to a power issue, it takes 3 times as long to get home by bus. 😐

items.content_html: Unexpected perk of working in a downtown Seattle skyscraper. I’m getting a good view of the Blue Angels practice this afternoon for their performance this weekend. 😁

items.title: Morning commute
items.content_html: It’s been a little over a year since I’ve moved to Seattle and my commute switched to being reliant on mass transit. For the most part it’s been glorious but it does have the occasional challenge. Today’s morning commute involved trains being single tracked, having to switch trains at the second stop, and then train losing power in the tunnel between stations for about 5 minutes. With all that it still took me less time to get to work as compared to my old commute by car in California.
items.content_text: It’s been a little over a year since I’ve moved to Seattle and my commute switched to being reliant on mass transit. For the most part it’s been glorious but it does have the occasional challenge. Today’s morning commute involved trains being single tracked, having to switch trains at the second stop, and then train losing power in the tunnel between stations for about 5 minutes. With all that it still took me less time to get to work as compared to my old commute by car in California.
